snippet: The city’s Education Department also says a lower percentage of students have been held back a grade since 2014, attributing the drop to a change in state law.
abstract: Number of New York City public school students required to take summer classes or being held back is down compared to previous five years.
lead_paragraph: The city’s Education Department also says a lower percentage of students have been held back a grade since 2014, attributing the drop to a change in state law.

headline.main: Fewer New York City Students Must Go to School This Summer
headline.print_headline: Fewer New York City Students Must Go to School This Summer
